title: 'Happy hour has started at the Saxonwold shebeen' - Twitter reacts to #ZumaVote
text:
President Jacob Zuma has survived a motion of no confidence in his presidency, held via secret ballot in Parliament.

Following a two-hour debate and lengthy voting process, 198 MPs voted against the Democratic Alliance's bid to remove Zuma, while 177 voted for.

About 30 ANC MPs voted for Zuma to be removed.

Zuma has survived several previous motions of no confidence in his presidency over the last eight years, all held via open ballot.

Twitter, as always, had much to say about Zuma's survival.

Here is a collection of some of the funnier tweets.







Uyaz the amount of reshuffling that's gonna happen post this #ZumaVote will be unprecedented! So many sellouts! ???? pic.twitter.com/65jIFVgDrJ — Mhlengi Nqoba (@Conqueror_Jr23) August 8, 2017

#ZumaVote hai hai hai. The sangoma that zuma ia seeing is very strong man. And what ever machine they used has a virus shame. pic.twitter.com/JGb1YX5Afl — Nkosinathi*M (@Nathi_4_lyf) August 8, 2017

#ZumaVote #voteofnoconfidence



The President should be reshuffling as we speak. Right now! Before the hour ends. pic.twitter.com/DQL5IjhW3j — MaKunene (@Nhle_Mntimande) August 8, 2017

You guys actually thought Zuma was gonna be voted out? Lol. Shem. You all know your country moes. #ZumaVote pic.twitter.com/gF0Y2GUd7N — Samuel (@tshilidzitenda1) August 8, 2017
description: President Jacob Zuma has survived a motion of no confidence in his presidency, held via secret ballot in Parliament. See what Twitter had to say.
